definition: to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: Many schools around the country have adopted similar coursework.
sentences.chinese: 全國許多學校創立了相似的課程。

sentences.english: Prior to GSR, Sonny was the co-founder of Asia Wireless Technology Corp.
sentences.chinese: 創立金沙江基金以前，伍伸俊是亞洲無線科技創始人。

sentences.english: Together with three friends, he founded a group called the Labor Exchange Band.
sentences.chinese: 他與3個朋友一起創立了“交工樂隊”。

sentences.english: Morita psychotherapy was developed by Japanese psychiatrist Shoma Morita in the early part of the twentieth century.
sentences.chinese: 森田療法是20世紀前葉由日本森田正馬教授創立的。

sentences.english: Palmer, who created the company Blue Star Line last year, declined to make a similar boast.
sentences.chinese: 去年創立藍星航運公司的帕爾默不願誇下這樣的海口。

sentences.english: They help start-ups and they sell license equity.
sentences.chinese: 他們幫助新創立企業，出售許可證。

sentences.english: Use your PDA or computer to set up those long-term ticklers .
sentences.chinese: 用你的掌上電腦或臺式電腦創立那些長期的備忘錄。

sentences.english: The tint of religion was even strengthened after Zhang Jizhong founded the Northern Sect.
sentences.chinese: 張積中創立北宗後更有宗教化傾向。

sentences.english: The Shijingshan Iron Smeltery, founded in 1919, predecessor of the Shoudu Iron and Steel Co.
sentences.chinese: 首鋼的前身是石景山鍊鋼廠，創立於1919年。

sentences.english: He founded in 1998 Xiaodian District essence auto repair shop.
sentences.chinese: 他於1998年創立小店區精華汽車修理廠。

sentences.english: Hegel initiates a system of law philosophy in his Principles of Legal Philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 黑格爾《法哲學原理》創立了法哲學學科體系。
印度創立了敘事詩文學。

sentences.english: The famous-brand product of Leye organic thorny pear shall be found to promote production development well. 5.
sentences.chinese: 創立樂業“名牌”有機刺梨，促進生產良性發展。

sentences.english: Niu Gensheng, a former Yili employee, founded Mengniu in 1999.
sentences.chinese: 前伊利僱員牛根生，在1999年創立蒙牛集團。

sentences.english: He advises young people to start a business that does not require expensive space.
sentences.chinese: 他建議年輕人應創立不需昂貴空間的企業。

definition: to offer (goods or services)/to open (for business etc)
to open/to start (a business etc)/to set up
to originate/to initiate/to launch (an attack, an initiative etc)/to start/to propose sth (for the first time)
to hold a governmental office or post/to assume office of/to take charge of/to serve as
